intro: Rapistrum macedonicum, commonly known as the Macedonian rapeseed, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately lobed leaves. It is often found growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
